replies.body: Oh man, good luck to all silver 1's currently.
You can't decay anymore in Silver or Gold, that means you were just losing a bunch.
Actually, if your MMR reaches Silver 5 level, you will decay to Silver 1.
You should probably just not play ranked for these days as you will not demote.
I will need it...  If i dont make it to good i will end up like this guy ----> {{champion:32}}
Gold 5, just in fucking time. whos with me?

December 31st 1969 I was born. I played Pokemon on the gameboy almost everyday in school. I was always bullied by the cool kids at my school. I decided that i would go on strike. So i became a professional gamer in my moms basement. In 1986 I bought my first computer. I still use this computer to this day. In 2009 I beta tested League of Legends. League of Legends was a game that reminded me of my experiences with Pokemon. Ups and downs almost every game, and by downs I mean people telling me I have down syndrome. I however am not a victim of this disease I was tested on July 23rd 2009. The doctor told me that I am unique, not down syndromed. I spent years in my moms basement striving to be the best gamer around. When ranked finally came I played it immediately and was very pleased to be ranked in Bronze 5. When you think about the Olympics bronze means 3rd. So therefore i was 3rd best in the whole wide world. That day that i became Bronze 5 I began my long treck up the ladder. And by ladder i mean the ladder from the basement to the living room. The sunlight almost killed me, but i knew my mother would be proud of me, and so i marched on. I slowly and slowly climbed my way up the ladder but suddenly i slipped and fell all the way back down to the bottom. I almost killed myself the, pain and suffering that i felt while lying at the very bottom of this ladder was unexplainable. I began my trek back up the ladder and slowly climbed out of the darkness. As i was taking my last few steps up the ladder it seemed as if the darkness was grabbing me and holding me in place. I would not let this phase me now I was so close to my goals. I pushed on and climbed all the way out of the darkness. I stood at the top of the ladder and was blinded by a golden light. This light seemed almost unreachable, yet i reached it. It only took me 4 years of my life to achieve this wonderful feeling and be in the position of which i am now.

> "Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that." -Martin Luther King Jr.

Take these words into consideration as you fight for the rank you desire. Don't let the darkness destroy the brightness that lives within you.

> "Life's not about how hard of a hit you can give... it's about how many you can take, and still keep moving forward." -Rocky Balboa

I have achieved Gold V this season and wish all of you luck on getting the rank you deserve and desire.

                              -Thanks For Reading
Post of the Season!
I'm pretty sure this guy has down syndrome, which only makes this story more compelling. Keep {{summoner:6}} friend.

help me with my essay for english.
i might fall back again to my senior year

Finally got Silver. might not be much to you guys but it's made my day.

First year playing.  Been playing since Sept made it to silver.  I'm happy with the progress I've made from the week long grind to 30 then taking a few weeks off then coming back grinding out runes then started my push.  Made silver 5 through provisionals then went up to silver 2.  Started getting troll teammates and I slowly saw my decay take effect from silver 2 back to silver 5.  So next season my goal is to at least hit plat 5 and go from there for the next season.
IT TOOK YOU 3 YEARS TO GET LVL 30?????????????
hahaha ^ lol this guy
you da real MVP {{item:2010}} {{item:2010}}

I made silver this year too, i started in April and i was soo bad xD I didnt use the shop till  was level 20, cause i didnt know what to buy xD but yea, im pretty proud of myself for getting to silver from starting at level 1 in 7 months
*looks at pile of homework* Um.. *glances at laptop, sweat beads appear on forehead* Uh.....
I suggest doing your homework so stress doesn't affect the games. {{champion:19}} <--- Like this guy.
I'm not even lvl 30 yet. {{item:3070}} {{champion:25}} {{item:3070}}

Don't think that way, when you are lvl 30, the game changes a lot. Games become a lot more boring and more competitive when you hit it.
So... make use of your lvl 20-30 times.
lvl 20-29 was so troll for me. Either I had to solo carry my games to victory or I got matched with a Platinum and fed.

Kids these days care too much about this game. Before I hit level 30, I never even bothered checking people's ranks. I just played the damn game and if I fed, I fed, if I did well, I did well, I didn't give a damn what rank people were. 

Man, those were good times.
in ranked it gets really stressful, especially if ur trying to reach a goal and r being trolled by afks or noobs. gets on my nerves, almost pnched my laptop once.
To everyone sitting in bronze and silver 1: Never give up, and never surrender!
Unless you are losing at a score of 32-0
Maybe give up, maybe surrender!
Because of day light savings time, we have an extra hour to get to gold. GG

Glad I met my goal! Got plat V in my first year on league, I'm so happy. Started from silver V in March and got to Plat V in August. Anyone who believes they can't get out, keep positive you will! :) 5 days is enough to reach your goal, keep trying. Good luck to all and hope you achieve that goal you wanted to reach. You **CAN **do it!

Same here bro I was b5 hahaha got plat 5 about two weeks ago :p the biggest change I had to make was the way I looked at the game and the effort I made to have as much map awareness as I possibly could/ communicate awareness politely!!

Indeed, very well done. I was Bronze III last year, but I didn't know what I was doing. This year, I cracked down and learned a good bit more. I'm easing myself into Ranked, having slowly gotten used to it this last week. Next season, my plan is to just play plenty of Ranked, and let what happens happen. Only way to improve, no? :)

Moral of the story: Don't get a girlfriend, League is Life

Silver V, I'm almost there :)
Damn this whole discussion is mostly complaints.
I made level 30 like 4 days ago and I rushed through the placement matches hoping I'd get placed in gold. Finished them last night... Silver 4{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

Yeah, I agree with the TruBluLew. That's what happened to me in season 3. I got placed s4, then I went on a losing streak and dropped to s5. Then, I found myself struggling to win. It took me a while to realize that I wasn't winning not because of bad teammates or smurfs, or even trolls. I was losing because I sucked, and the fate of unskilled players is loss.

So, I proceeded to read a ton of guides, watch videos, streams, and practice with friends who I knew were good. I soon gained the game knowledge and mechanical ability I needed to carry myself throughout the ladder this season, and carried myself from bronze 2 to gold 3. I highly recommend getting good before trying to tackle the ladder, because the ladder is supposed to be reflective of your skill, not the other way around.

Try watching a bunch of people like foxdrop, gbay99, and the leaguecraft lecture series. If you haven't already, memorize every champion's skillset and what roles/builds they can do effectively. Also, try to be mature about things that go sour in games. Don't flame your teammates for making mistakes, and try to recognize what you could've done better, because most of the time bad things happen when multiple people make mistakes. And last but not least, enjoy the climb! If you're getting stressed out, then take a break. This is just a game, after all :P

The best advice I can give to you is play normals. A LOT of normals. Once you're comfortable enough, then jump back into ranked. Believe me, this method is better than just jumping into ranked at level 30. You'll be more comfortable in the game, more confident in your play, and you'll rank/climb a lot more than you would if you just jumped back into ranked immediately. Good luck :D
